question.title: Spurious warning about incompatible .class files version in vscode-java
question.body:
I often get a warning with vscode-java that I believe is incorrect: “Incompatible .class files version in required binaries. Project … is targeting a 17 runtime, but is compiled against '….jar' (from the container 'Maven Dependencies') which requires a 21 runtime”. I have inspected the JAR and it is supposed to be compatible with a 17 runtime. And indeed my project runs like a charm even though I only have Java 17 installed.

I have filed an issue to vscode-java but it attracted no attention so far. Hence, I suspect that I may be doing something wrong, or perhaps have some configuration peculiarity that raises this problem on my machine but not on others.

Is there any workaround for avoiding this warning? Or am I actually using a wrong JAR version?

Opening this project in vscode with java pack and a Java 17 JRE should reproduce the problem, if the Eclipse include compiler settings modify the severity related to option id org.eclipse.jdt.core.incompatibleJDKLevel.
